metadata.name: Potential Recon Activity Using DriverQuery.EXE
metadata.comment: Detect usage of the "driverquery" utility to perform reconnaissance on installed drivers

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('driverquery.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('drvqry.exe') AND (endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\cscript.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\mshta.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\regsvr32.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\rundll32.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\wscript.exe'))) AND (contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\appdata\\local\\')) OR contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\users\\public\\')) OR contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\windows\\temp\\'))))

output.summary: Detect usage of the "driverquery" utility to perform reconnaissance on installed drivers

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate usage by some scripts might trigger this as well References: https://thedfirreport.com/2023/01/09/unwrapping-ursnifs-gifts/, https://www.vmray.com/cyber-security-blog/analyzing-ursnif-behavior-malware-sandbox/, https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/01/saigon-mysterious-ursnif-fork.html
